thread.title: Whoopi Goldberg Becomes Incensed At Talk Of Defunding Planned Parenthood
thread.title_full: Whoopi Goldberg Becomes Incensed At Talk Of Defunding Planned Parenthood

author: Ron Capshaw
title: Whoopi Goldberg Becomes Incensed At Talk Of Defunding Planned Parenthood
text:
Whoopi Goldberg Becomes Incensed At Talk Of Defunding Planned Parenthood "I'm not there to judge. God judges." by Ron Capshaw January 7, 2017 at 3:40pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
The View is known for lively debates, but co-host Whoopi Goldberg may have taken it up a notch. 
A day after Speaker of the House Paul Ryan promised that Planned Parenthood would be defunded along with Obamacare, Goldberg went ballistic Friday in a debate with co-host Jedediah Bila. 
When told by co-host Sara Haines that more than 80 percent of Planned Parenthood’s patients live below the poverty line, Goldberg turned her anger toward Bila. Advertisement - story continues below 
Goldberg said the proposed defunding would target low-income women. 
“The only people who are going to eat it when Planned Parenthood goes away are women who need the services,” she said. Advertisement - story continues below 
Bila countered that some taxpayers have moral and religious issues with their money going to an organization that performs abortions. 
Goldberg said she had religious reasons for supporting Planned Parenthood. 
“My religious background says that I’m supposed to make sure that people are serviced, that’s what my religion says. I’m not there to judge. God judges,” she said. 
Bila, a self-described libertarian , said people on the pro-life side of the aisle aren’t telling women what to do with their bodies. They just don’t want their taxes going for abortions. Advertisement - story continues below WJ Investigates: Critics Warn Recent Minimum-Wage Hikes Will Have Wide-Ranging Impact 
Too bad, Goldberg said. 
She compared her tax money going to President-elect Trump’s proposed plan to build a wall on the Mexican border to tax money going to fund abortions. 
Goldberg said she didn’t like her money going to build a wall, but that’s the price of being an American. 
Despite Goldberg’s decibel level going up, Bila remained firm. 
She said Ryan was correct in planning to defund Planned Parenthood, citing the undercover videos that allegedly showed the clinics making money off the sale of fetal tissue from aborted babies. 
Goldberg returned to her argument about the price of being an American. 
“My thing about America is that people have to pay their fair share for things they don’t like and things they do like,” Goldberg said. “You may not like abortion — don’t have one.” 
The argument continued until Goldberg called for a timeout. 
“We’re going to take a break! We’ll be right back! God!,” she shouted.
